Dialogue.NPCText:
The man before you is clad in battered finery: a Frostbite Silk Undershirt (glimmering pale blue), salt-scarred apron, and an extravagant Tricorne Hat rimed with frost and perched at a rakish angle. His boots bear the stains of brine and snow. An invisible weight rides his shoulder—then you notice, now and then, a faint shimmer as a ghostly monkey chitters and vanishes.

"Aye, I see you’re admirin’ the hat. Only the best for Captain Urven Slate—ice-runner, smuggler, and, as of last frost, respectable merchant. Or so I tell the good folk at Lira’s inn.
Come for a tale, a deal, or just a little trouble? My monkey picks pockets, but I don’t bite—unless you’re Minaxian. Speak up, before the wind steals your tongue."

Option.text: You must be the infamous Captain Slate. What brings you to Frostmere?
Is that... an invisible monkey?
Lira sent me; she said you have work for someone handy.
You look like trouble. Why should anyone trust you?
I’m looking for honest work—anything legal or... otherwise?
Tell me about your past. You’ve seen some things.
Just passing through, Captain.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Ha! Infamous, eh? Guilty as charged. I ran sunrunner sleds down from Sunreach, dodgin’ pirates, monsters, and the sort of cold that’d turn yer spit to daggers. After a falling out with certain... ex-associates (and a bit too much attention from Minax’s mutts), I set up shop here.
Garrik’ll tell you I’m no saint, but I’d sooner lose a hand than turn a friend to Minax. Lira trusts me with her best whisky, Svala trusts me with nothing—so, you’re safe in my company, or at least in good hands if it all goes sideways."

Option.text: Have any work that pays coin?
Tell me about this falling out. You tangled with Minax?
Who’s your monkey friend?
Maybe I’ll be on my way.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Ah! You’ve the sharpest eyes in Frostmere. That’s Dibs—the best thief on this coast, and nigh impossible to catch unless you carry a sack of candied figs. Found him years ago in a Sunreach bazaar. Old sorcerer said he was cursed to fade in and out of sight, which makes him both a boon and a menace.
Dibs mostly nabs trinkets, never anything vital. Well—almost never. If anything of yours goes missing, ask at the White Boar. Lira’s gotten used to finding oddments in her bread bin."

Option.text: Dibs sounds clever. Now, about that work...
Has Dibs ever stolen anything important?
Maybe I’ll be off.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Clever? He’s a right terror. Once snatched Garrik’s favorite hammer and hid it in a snowdrift for three days. Garrik’s temper nearly melted the tundra.
Dibs only steals what he fancies. Jewelry, bright buttons, shiny coins. Never a map, though. He knows my secrets are off limits—or he’ll end up the world’s first ghost monkey popsicle."

Option.text: Let’s talk business, then.
No thanks, Captain.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Ha! Lira’s always sending me hopeful sorts with empty mugs and quicker wits. She’s a gem. Treat her with respect and she’ll warm your bones; cross her and you’ll freeze twice before dawn.
Now, if you’ve got steel in your spine, I’ve a little trouble needs clearing. Pays in coin and a bit of Sunreach contraband, if you fancy something stronger than icewater."

Option.text: What’s the trouble?
Contraband? Tempting, but I’ll pass.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Why trust me? That’s a fair question. Truth is, I’ve earned my share of suspicion. Used to run with rough folk, sailed under a black flag or two—until Minax’s filth ruined the trade. I lost more than coin in that deal. These days, I run sleds for honest work (and a bit of not-so-honest when the need is dire). Garrik’ll vouch for me, and Lira too—if you buy her a drink first."

Option.text: Maybe I’ll trust you. Got any work?
Not my style. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Well then, enjoy the cold. Should you change your mind, I’ll be here—unless the monkey steals my boots again."

Option.text: Actually, maybe I am interested...

Dialogue.NPCText:
"There’s always work in Frostmere, if you’re nimble or bold. But today, I need someone with both brains and muscle. Something nasty’s crawled up from the glacial rifts—a Glacial Ooze, bigger than a rowboat, and twice as slimy. It's been freezing my sled tracks, spooking the dogs, and Dibs won’t even go near it.
I’d handle it myself, but last time I tried, my cutlass got half-digested. Svala says it’s the Obelisk’s fault—she always blames the magic. Garrik says it’s my luck. Either way, it needs dealing. Up for the job?"

Option.text: Tell me more about the Glacial Ooze.
Why not ask Svala or Garrik for help?
Sounds like a fair challenge. I’ll do it.
I don’t do slime. Find someone else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Oh, this isn’t your average puddle of muck. Glacial Oozes are living chunks of ice, corrupted by something deep in the old glacier. They’re nearly invisible against snow, and their touch will freeze your boots solid.
One got into the dogsled yard last night—turned two harnesses into icicles. The thing’s too tough for arrows, and if you hit it wrong, it just splits and comes back angrier. But it leaves behind a frozen core—bring me that, and you’ll get paid in coin, plus something from my personal stash. Maybe a Sunreach spice loaf, or a vial of rum older than Lira’s patience."

Option.text: Alright, I’ll handle the Glacial Ooze.
That sounds risky. Why not pay the militia?
I’ll pass on this one.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Urven grins, revealing a gold tooth.

"That’s the spirit! The Glacial Ooze slithers near the sled yard at dusk, or sometimes by the old shipwreck where the ice cracks deepest. Dibs won’t go near it, so you’re on your own. Smash its core and bring it here. If you find any relics by the shipwreck, let me know—there’s more treasure in those depths than most folk imagine.
Oh, and watch your step—if you see anything small and shiny run past, it's probably Dibs, not a frost sprite."

Option.text: I’ll return with the Ooze’s frozen core.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Ha! Svala’s too busy stalking ice elk, and Garrik’s wrists ache in the cold. Besides, last time Garrik fought a slime, he spent a week scraping ooze out of his beard. No, this job needs a new face and a steady hand.
Or maybe you’d like to ask the monkey, but he’s afraid of his own reflection in the ice."

Option.text: Point taken. I’ll deal with the ooze.
Maybe I’ll just leave you to it.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Bryndra’s lot are fine fighters, but she’d rather line the fences than chase slimes. Besides, she thinks I’m a ‘security risk’—too many late nights at Lira’s and too many secrets under my cloak. Best if we keep this between us. Fewer questions, quicker pay."

Option.text: Alright, I’ll take the job.
Maybe next time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Urven’s face darkens, shadows flickering under the brim of his hat.

"Aye, I crossed Minax’s path. Once. Thought I could outsmart her—smuggle artifacts out of Sunreach before her cult could get their claws in. Lost my ship, half my crew, and nearly Dibs too.
I’ll not speak more of it, but know this: Minax’s influence is cold, deeper than the permafrost. If you see anything marked with her sign on your hunt, burn it, or bring it straight to Irinya. Some wounds won’t heal, even with a bottle of rum."

Option.text: If I find anything suspicious, I’ll report to Irinya.
That sounds dangerous. Maybe I’m not cut out for this.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Urven chuckles, the sound rough and hollow like oars against ice.

"You’re not the first to ask. But most folk who dig into my past end up knee-deep in someone else's secrets, too. Still... you're either nosy or bold. And I like both."

Option.text: Start from the beginning. Where did it all begin?
Tell me about your crew. Who did you lose?
Do you regret it? Running freight, smuggling, fleeing Minax?
Ever think of settling down?
On second thought, forget it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Sunreach, back before it was crawling with spice barons and back-alley witches. I was a deckhand on the Frozen Violet—a trim little ship with a sail like a snow hawk's wing. We ran icewine and spirit sap down the Silver Coast.

Then came the shadow—Minax’s dogs in cloaks with black fire in their hands. They weren’t just looking to raid—they wanted things buried under the dunes. I saw them sink a ship with a whisper."

Option.text: You saw Minax’s agents up close?
Did you fight back?
What did they want under the dunes?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Aye. Pale-faced men who didn’t blink. Women with no shadows. They weren’t human—not really. We tried to outrun them. But they folded the sea. Bent the air like parchment. That’s when I knew Sunreach was lost."

Option.text: What did you do then?

Dialogue.NPCText: "We tried. Set fire to our own docks, blasted supply ships in the bay. But when a thing can rot steel from a mile off, courage don’t mean much. I lost good men—Tharn, Melynna, Soft-Eye Pekk. All burned or vanished."

Option.text: Sorry to hear that. What happened to your crew?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Artifacts, I think. Something buried from the old days. Magic from the Gem War, maybe even fragments of Mondain’s madness. Whatever it was, they found it. And that’s when I ran. Took Dibs, took what coin I could, and never looked back."

Option.text: So now you’re just a sled captain with a ghost monkey?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Some say the sea claims what the sky forgets. My crew—they were the best. No kings, no crowns, just salt and sail and sharp wit. We called ourselves the Ice-Kissed Knaves. Dumb name, but it stuck. Garrik was our smith. Lira sold our hooch. Frostmere’s the last echo of that life."

Option.text: That’s a fine name. You miss them?
I’ve heard of them. (If you have high Fame)

Dialogue.NPCText: "Aye? Then you’ve walked some long roads to know of us. Maybe you’ve got a story of your own worth listening to. Careful though—Dibs judges folk by their eyebrows."

Option.text: So what keeps you going?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Urven shrugs, the gesture heavy with memory.

"Regret’s for folk who had better options. I made my calls. Saved some, lost more. But I’ve still got my breath, my monkey, and the best boots in Frostmere. You learn to laugh or freeze. I chose laughter."

Option.text: Anything you wish you’d done different?
Ever think of starting a new crew?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Settle? I tried once. Opened a tavern in Nujel’m. Dibs drank all the rum, a sandwyrm stole my accountant, and the tax office burned down. So no, I think the road suits me fine."

Option.text: Dibs sounds like he’d make a fine mayor.
Fair enough. Got any cooking skills?
Just curious. Thanks for sharing.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Ah, you cook? So did Melynna. She made a sea-lobster pie that’d win wars. Here—this isn’t much, but Dibs swiped it from Lira's pantry and I don’t eat poultry."

Option.text: Appreciate it, Captain.
What’s Dibs’s favorite food?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Candied figs. The purple ones from Qasaria. He once stole forty from a merchant prince and stuffed them in Garrik’s forge. We didn’t have heat for a week, but Dibs slept like royalty."

Option.text: This was a good chat, Captain. You’ve got stories.
I’ll be off. See you around.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Start a new crew? Maybe. If I find the right blades. Someone brave, clever, with enough backbone to stare down frost witches and drunk pirates. Someone like..."

Option.action: SendMessage:Urven gives you a measuring look.

Option.text: I’ll think about it.
